typeInfo.label: Assets
typeInfo.value:
Represents the value of assets in U.S. dollars organized in four categories: residential, commercial, industrial and other. Information on types of assets and values were extracted from the FEMA-HAZUS database (Scawthorn et al. 2006)

Scawthorn, Charles, Paul Flores, Neil Blais, Hope Seligson, Eric Tate, Stephanie Chang, Edward Mifflin, et al. 2006. HAZUS-MH Flood Loss Estimation Methodology. II. Damage and Loss Assessment. Natural Hazards Review 7 (2) (May): 72–81. doi:10.1061/(ASCE)1527-6988(2006)7:2(72).

geographyInfo.label: Geography
geographyInfo.value: Values were originally obtained by block level and aggregated to census tracts and counties.

valuesInfo.label: Display map values by
valuesInfo.value:
Total Value: Total U.S dollar value of the asset in the spatial unit, aggregated from the block level.

Percent Total: Represents percentage of change with respect to the total value taken as reference in the present day (2010).

y-axis.label: Graph Y-Axis
y-axis.value: Represents the value of assets in U.S. dollars (billions).

typeInfo.label: Hazard Type
typeInfo.value: Represents the expected losses associated with either a Flood or Wind event.

growthInfo.label: Economic Growth Scenario
growthInfo.value: Economic scenarios represent different future estimates of economic growth. For each future timeline (2030 and 2050), future values of assets are projected by 1% economic growth and 0.5% demographic growth for a “low economy” and by 2% and 1%, respectively, for a “high economy”. See table of scenarios. These estimates were chosen considering (1) historical rates and (2) projections for the region.

defenseInfo.label: Defense Type
defenseInfo.value: Accounts for natural and existing protection along the shore and at high-risk urban areas: None (Bathtub), Low Estimates, and High Estimates.

assetInfo.label: Reference Year for Assets
assetInfo.value: Future timelines used for estimating Risks.

climateInfo.label: Reference Year
climateInfo.value: Future timelines used for estimating Risks.

protectionInfo.label: Standard of Protection (year)
protectionInfo.value: The protection offered to a specific area from a hazard event usually described in terms of a flood event return period.  For example, a particular defense could be described as providing a 1 in 100 year standard of protection meaning that over time the defense will fail once every one hundred years.

valuesInfo.label: Display map values by
valuesInfo.value:
Total Value: Total U.S dollar of the average losses distributed on a yearly basis (Annual Expected Damages) in the spatial unit.

Percent Change: Represents percentage of change with respect to the total value taken as reference in the present day (2010).

x-axis.label: Risk Profile Graph X-Axis
x-axis.value: Total amount of damages in U.S. dollars (billions).

y-axis.label: Risk Profile Graph Y-Axis
y-axis.value: Risk associated with the present day (2010), the contribution from economic growth alone, the contribution from future climate alone, and the future (including the combined increase from both economic growth and climate change) relative to expected damages in 2010.

slider_error.label: Invalid Information
slider_error.value: Data with a combination of Assets in ASSETYEAR and Climate in CLIMATEYEAR does not exist. Sliders have been automatically adjusted to an allowable combination.

Economic.label: Expected Future Damages from Economy
Economic.value: $VALUE (US) in expected damages in the future from economic growth alone representing a PERCENT increase relative to expected damages in 2010.

Climate.label: Expected Future Damages from Climate
Climate.value: $VALUE (US) in expected damages in the future from climate change alone representing a PERCENT increase relative to expected damages in 2010.

Total.label: Expected Future Damages in FUTUREYEAR
Total.value: $VALUE (US) in total expected damages in the future (including increase from both economic growth and climate change) representing a PERCENT increase relative to expected damages in 2010.

typeInfo.label: Model Form
typeInfo.value: Calculate benefits and costs using different sets of parameters and assumptions: Best Estimates (Default), Sensitivity of performance of Nature-based Defenses,a nd Conservative in performance and costs for Nature-based Defenses.

growthInfo.label: Economic Growth Scenario
growthInfo.value: Economic scenarios represent different future estimates of economic growth. For each future timeline (2030 and 2050), future values of assets are projected by 1% economic growth and 0.5% demographic growth for a “low economy” and by 2% and 1%, respectively, for a “high economy”. See table of scenarios. These estimates were chosen considering (1) historical rates and (2) projections for the region.

defenseInfo.label: Defense Type
defenseInfo.value: Accounts for natural and existing protection along the shore and at high-risk urban areas: None (Bathtub), Low Estimates, and High Estimates.

climateInfo.label: Reference Year
climateInfo.value: Future timelines used for estimating Adaptation and Risk Reduction.

x-axis.label: Cost Curve Graph X-Axis
x-axis.value: Represents total losses avoided in U.S. dollars. Note the wider the bar, the greater the amount of damages averted

y-axis.label: Cost Curve Graph Y-Axis
y-axis.value: Represents the benefit over cost ratio.  Note the higher the bar, the more cost-effective of a measure.

graph-bar.label: NAME
graph-bar.value:
Benefit-cost ratio for avoided damages from present to FUTUREYEAR is CBRATIO with a total amount of $CBDAMAGE (US) in damages averted.

Note the height of the bar (the higher the bar, the more cost-effective of a measure) and the width (the larger the bar, the greater the amount of damages averted) relative to other measures. Cost-Benefit ratios below a value of 1 (the red dashed line) represent particularly ineffective adaptation measures relative to their cost to implement.
